intro: Saccolabium culiciferum, commonly known as the pink thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, and its spiny, branched stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Saccolabium culiciferum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, rocky soils.
